cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the central Gulf, then turning north toward the central Louisiana coast and moving inland toward western Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon/Houma

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River. Tropical Storm Watch: none west of Cameron LA.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of Pearl River, including Metro New Orleans. Tropical Storm Warning: Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA and eastward to the AL/FL border.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana and Mississippi coasts, with lesser effects extending westward to the upper Texas coast (Sabine Pass area).
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands may bring sustained 25–35 mph winds with occasional gusts to near 40 mph late Sunday night through Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible near Sabine Pass and the lower Neches River, including approaches to Beaumont.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent rain possible Sunday night through Monday, locally higher in heavy bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low but non-zero risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast.
